articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: For Kyiv-area resident Olha Pavlovska, who huddles with her neighbours every week to discuss the often grim news from the front, Ukraine's shock incursion into Russia's Kursk region this month offered a rare moment of hope.
articles.title: Kursk incursion boosts Ukrainian morale after grim year

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Former U.S. President Barack Obama will endorse his longtime political ally Kamala Harris on Tuesday night in a high-profile speech that aims to boost her presidential bid over Republican Donald Trump.
articles.title: DNC Tuesday: Obama the headliner, will campaign for Harris

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine launched a widespread drone attack on Russia on Wednesday, with air defence units destroying three drones some 38 kms (24 miles) south of the Kremlin, and 15 over the border Bryansk region, Russian officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine launches drone attack on Moscow, other regions, Russian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Oil products tanker Sounion was attacked by two small boats and struck by three projectiles in the Red Sea off Yemen on Wednesday, causing damage to the vessel but no injuries, the Greek shipping ministry and UK maritime agency UKMTO said.
articles.title: Tanker reports attack off Yemen's Hodeidah, UK maritime agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Divers resumed a search on Wednesday for survivors after British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch's yacht sank off the coast of Sicily amid an intense storm two days ago, though hopes dwindled of finding the six missing people alive.
articles.title: Search resumes for six missing after Mike Lynch's yacht sank, but hopes dim

articles.author: Luis Jaime Acosta
articles.description: Amid stifling heat and humidity in the remote Colombian jungle, guerrillas carrying machine guns and rifles creep their way through the undergrowth, patrolling along a river where their presence assures control over important transport routes for the cocaine they tax.
articles.title: Meet the secretive Colombian guerrillas who could deal final blow to peace plan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken discussed the latest state efforts to secure a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas in a phone call on Wednesday, Turkey's foreign ministry spokesperson said.
articles.title: Turkish, U.S. top diplomats discuss Gaza ceasefire efforts in call, Ankara says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah launched an attack with a swarm of drones on military posts in the kibbutz of Amiad in northern Israel, the armed group said in a statement on Wednesday.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it launched a drone attack on military posts in northern Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three employees of a high school in the western Bosnian town of Sanski Most were killed and one seriously wounded when a man also employed in the school opened fire on Wednesday, local media reported citing the regional police.
articles.title: Three dead, one wounded in shooting in school in western Bosnia, local media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Taliban have barred United Nations-appointed special rapporteur Richard Bennett from entering Afghanistan, the administration's spokesperson told local broadcaster Tolo, accusing the human rights watchdog of "spreading propaganda".
articles.title: Taliban bars UN human rights special rapporteur from Afghanistan
